Description: Rim sherd of Laconian, probably black-figured pottery kylix; cream slip; interior: traces of narrow black band below lip above net pattern frieze with added red accents where lozenges join; below, traces of narrow black band; exterior: traces of one or possibly two black lines lip; rising bud frieze with red accents and black dots in interstices; below, narrow black band.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B7.4.15)
Stibbe 1972 / Lakonische Vasenmaler des sechsten Jahrhunderts v. Chr. (p. 273, no. 67, pl. 26.11-2)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 547, no. E2)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 395, no.1)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 239, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.24) (Phase 1)
